alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 6:19AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ONONDAGA...SOUTHERN ONEIDA...MADISON...AND NORTHERN ONEIDA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 616 AM EST, a lake effect snow band extended across far northern Cayuga and covered much of Oswego County. The band is moving east-southeast at about 20 mph and will move into extreme northern Onondaga County by 630 AM. Northern portions of the Syracuse metro area will also be affected. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Clay, Rome, Cicero, Lysander, Van Buren, Oneida, Baldwinsville, North Syracuse, Lee and Verona. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 33 and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 25 and 30. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida
